newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: INSIGHT - DUTCH CHARTISTS REMAIN DIVIDED OVER AEX.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - DUTCH CHARTISTS REMAIN DIVIDED OVER AEX.

text.p: Most Dutch chartists remain
cautious about the short term prospects for the AEX share index,
some saying the AEX could undergo a major decline if it slips
through support at 700 points. Two out of five contributors to
our regular survey were concerned about the recent increase in
market volatility. ABN Amro remains broadly positive.
The AEX index closed at 740.99 points on Thursday, 13.69
points above the previous week's close. In the week before that
the index had shed 38.76 points.
Contributor Trend Pvs view Support Resistance
First Second First Second
ABN AMRO Up Up 710 700 750 779
Rabo Sec. Neutral Neutral 700 670 733 748
MeesPierson Neutral Down 700 685 748 779
ING Barings Down Down 710 700 735 750
Note - Contributors' own analysis follows.
ING BARINGS - As expected last week, the rebound was strong,
but it could not lift the selling condition of the AEX.
Chart-resistance and the 9-day moving average line of the AEX,
both at 740, have thwarted a further rise. At 740, the AEX has
also corrected 50 percent of its recent steep 80 point drop (780
to 700). This 50 percent retracement level weighs heavily on the
charts. Momentum lines below the crucial 0-level confirm bearish
technicals. Expect a test of support at 700. If 700 gives way,
then next targets come in around 686 and 660. A move above 780
is needed to trigger a durable buying condition. Money flow
remains toppy, reflecting selling pressure kicking in.
Advance/Decline ratio's have also formed a (minor) top,
suggesting that leadership in the market is decreasing. All in
all, the short term technicals of the AEX remain bearish.
MEESPIERSON - As we mentioned last week already, the risks
were on the downside. We saw a confirmation of all this on April
Fool's Day. The indicators are basically of no use in such sharp
declines, and we think the market will stay volatile in between
the 700 and 748 levels. After a calm-down, we expect further
continuation of the long term uptrend.
RABO SECURITIES - We expect the market to remain very
volatile but we do expect support at 700 to hold up. Although
the AEX could easily be at the higher end of the broad trading
range by the end of the week, we prefer to stay neutral for the
time being. However, a break of support at 700 would immediately
trigger a sell signal and open the way to the 670 level.
ABN AMRO - We stick to our previous positive opinion. There
has been another sharp correction within a longer term uptrend.
Again, support has been found slightly above 700. We expect
positive momentum to pick up again and foresee a renewed attack
on the 750 level. We continue to prefer an aggressive approach
in this market and advise reopening long positions. This move up
can take place in a very short time frame. The market is heavily
oversold and waiting to bounce up again.
-- Amsterdam newsroom, +31 20 504 5000, Fax 31 20 504 5040
